intro: Aethusa cynapium var. segetalis, commonly known as the field cowbane, is a toxic plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and compound umbel-like inflorescence that bears small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
